docs.description: An overview of the WebSockets API, detailing how to establish persistent, full-duplex communication channels between a client and server over a single TCP connection.
An overview of the WebRTC API, which enables real-time communication capabilities in web browsers and mobile applications.
A guide on developing client applications using the WebSockets API for real-time, bidirectional communication over a single TCP connection.

notes.description: This resource explains how to implement real-time updates in React applications using WebSockets and React Hooks.
An overview of using WebSockets for enabling real-time communication in distributed systems.
This resource explains WebSocket technology and highlights its differences from HTTP.
This article compares Server-Sent Events (SSE) and WebSockets, highlighting their differences, use cases, and performance in real-time web applications.
The article compares WebSocket and WebRTC protocols in system design, highlighting their differences and use cases.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of the WebSocket protocol?
options: To establish a full-duplex communication channel over a single TCP connection
To enhance HTTP requests with additional security features
To improve the speed of data transmission over the internet
To provide a fallback for AJAX in real-time applications
quiz.hint: Think about how WebSockets differ from traditional HTTP in terms of communication direction.

quiz.question: Which Node.js library is commonly used to simplify the implementation of WebSockets?
options: Express.js
Socket.IO
Axios
Nest.js
quiz.hint: This library is specifically designed to handle WebSockets and falls back to other protocols if necessary.

quiz.question: What is a key advantage of using WebSockets for building real-time features like chat applications?
options: WebSockets reduce server load by eliminating the need for polling.
WebSockets increase latency by adding more steps in communication.
WebSockets are easier to implement than AJAX.
WebSockets allow only one-way communication.
quiz.hint: Consider how WebSockets manage data flow compared to HTTP polling.

quiz.question: Which of the following is a challenge when scaling WebSockets for a large number of users?
options: Maintaining a persistent connection with each client
Ensuring data privacy over the connections
Managing HTTP request headers efficiently
Reducing the server's CPU usage
quiz.hint: Think about the nature of WebSocket connections and what they require from the server.

quiz.question: In the context of Socket.IO, what is the primary function of namespaces?
options: To segregate different types of client connections on the same server
To enhance security by encrypting data packets
To manage different versions of the Socket.IO library
To log user activities for monitoring purposes
quiz.hint: Consider how namespaces help organize and manage WebSocket connections on a server.
